{{Infobox Officeholder | name=Lionel Gordon Ott | nationality=[[United States|American]] | office=[[Louisiana State Senate|Louisiana State Senator for Orleans Parish]] | term_start=1940 | term_end=1945 | preceded= | succeeded=Alexander E. Rainold | office2= [[New Orleans City Council|New Orleans Finance Commissioner]] | party=[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] | term_start2=1946 | term_end2=1954 | preceded2= | succeeded2=Position abolished under the [[mayor-council]] government | birth_date={{birth date|1894|7|25}} | death_date={{death date and age|1987|10|16|1894|7|25}} | birth_place=[[Mount Hermon, Louisiana|Mount Hermon]]
[[Washington Parish, Louisiana|Washington Parish]]
[[Louisiana]], USA | death_place= | resting_place=[[Metairie Cemetery]] in [[New Orleans]] | alma_mater=[[Mount Hermon High School]] | occupation=[[Accountant]] | residence=New Orleans, Louisiana | spouse=(1) Helen Merritt Ott
(2) Carolyn McCormick Ott | children=No children | parents=Elbert Weston and Martha Estelle Leggett Ott | branch= | battles= | footnotes= }} '''Lionel Gordon Ott''' (July 25, 1894 – October 16, 1987){{cite web|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=Ott&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSst=20&GScnty=1144&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=114040481&df=all&|title=Lionel G. Ott|publisher=findagrave.com|accessdate=March 1, 2015}} was an [[accountant]] and a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] [[politician]] from [[New Orleans, Louisiana|New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]], who served in the 20th century as a [[Louisiana State Senate|state senator]] and as a member of the [[New Orleans City Council]]. ==Biography== Ott was born in the [[unincorporated community]] of [[Mount Hermon, Louisiana|Mount Hermon]] in [[Washington Parish, Louisiana|Washington Parish]] in southeastern Louisiana, one of the [[Florida Parishes]]. He was the sixth of ten children (one died on the day of birth), born to Elbert Weston Ott (1855-1924) of Mount Hermon, Louisiana, who was of [[Germany|German]] and [[France|French]] descent, and the former Martha Estelle Leggett (1860-1955, a native of [[Mississippi]]. His father was engaged in the mercantile and planting businesses and instituted the [[United States Postal Service|post office]] in Mount Hermon. Young Ott worked in his father's store and office and became self-educating in the field of accounting. The senior Ott was known for his strong support for [[prohibition]] of [[alcohol|alcoholic beverages]].{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=w-YxAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA1058&lpg=PA1058&dq=Lionel+Gordon+Ott+of+New+Orleans&source=bl&ots=R68X-S6TWg&sig=zyauwNgHvPCUPfdPfwGyi7AJfZM&hl=en&sa=X&ei=1JXzVKipKcKsyATQmYCoDQ&ved=0CCcQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=Lionel%20Gordon%20Ott%20of%20New%20Orleans&f=false|title=History of New Orleans, Vol. 3|author=John Smith Kendall|publisher=Lewis Publishing Company|location=[[Chicago]] and [[New York City]]|date=1922|pages=1058–1059|accessdate=March 1, 2015}} In 1918, Ott moved to New Orleans to enter the accounting firm of Smith and Skinner. In 1921, he formed his own company, Ott and Prados. He was active in the [[Masonic lodge]] and the Young Men's Business Club. In 1940, Ott was elected to one of the eight state Senate slots from [[Orleans Parish, Louisiana|Orleans Parish]]. He served during the administrations of [[governor of Louisiana|Governors]] [[Sam H. Jones]] and [[Jimmie Davis]]. He resigned in 1945 early in his second term.{{cite web|url=http://senate.la.gov/Documents/Membership/1880membership.pdf|title=Membership in the Louisiana State Senate since 1880|publisher=senate.la.gov|accessdate=March 1, 2015}} The next year, he was elected commissioner of finance on the New Orleans City Council under the [[city commission government]]. He was reelected as finance commissioner in 1950.{{cite web|url=http://nutrias.org/inv/council/ott.htm|title=Commissioner Lionel G. Ott|publisher=nutrias.org|accessdate=March 1, 2015}} The [[Mayor of New Orleans|mayor]] at the time of Ott's two council terms was [[deLesseps Story Morrison]], a subsequent three-time candidate for governor. In 1952, Ott joined the [[Ticket (politics)|ticket]] of gubernatorial candidate [[James M. McLemore]] a [[cattle]]man from [[Alexandria, Louisiana|Alexandria]] in [[Central Louisiana]], in an unsuccessful bid for [[Lieutenant Governor of Louisiana|lieutenant governor]]. Much of the campaigning was conducted in the last few months of 1951.''Minden Herald'', January 3, 1952, p. 1The [[New Orleans Public Library]] (nutrias.org) erroneously states that Lionel Ott was the running-mate of [[Robert F. Kennon]] in 1952, instead of [[James M. McLemore]]. Elmer David Conner (1905-1965) of [[Jennings, Louisiana|Jennings]] in [[Jefferson Davis Parish, Louisiana|Jefferson Davis Parish]] in southwestern Louisiana, was Kennon's running-mate and later his director of the Louisiana Department of Commerce and Industry. While [[Robert F. Kennon]] won the governorship, [[C. E. "Cap" Barham]] of [[Ruston, Louisiana|Ruston]], the choice of gubernatorial candidate [[Hale Boggs]], the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. representative]] from [[Louisiana's 2nd congressional district]],"Boggs '52 ticket listed", ''Minden Herald'', October 19, 1951, p. 1 was placed into a [[runoff election]] with the later Governor [[John McKeithen]] for the second position. Barham prevailed and served one term until his own defeat in 1956 by the educator [[Lether Frazar]]. Ott was twice married; his wives were the former Helen Merritt and Carolyn McCormick (1912-2007). He had no children.{{cite web|url=http://jliptrap.us/gen/devecmon.htm|title=332. Elbert Weston Ott|publisher=jliptrap.us|accessdate=March 1, 2015}} He is interred beside his second wife at [[Metairie Cemetery]] in New Orleans. Ott's papers are housed at the [[New Orleans Public Library]]. {{Portalbar|Biography|New Orleans|Louisiana|Business and Economics|Politics}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{succession box |before=Eight at-large members |title=Member of the [[Louisiana State Senate]] from [[Orleans Parish, Louisiana|Orleans Parish]] Lionel Gordon Ott |years=1940–1945 |after=Alexander E. Rainold}} {{succession box |before=Missing |title=[[New Orleans City Council|New Orleans Finance Commissioner]] (citywide) Lionel Gordon Ott |years=1946–1954 |after=Position abolished under new [[city charter]]}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ott, Lionel}} [[Category:1894 births]] [[Category:1987 deaths]] [[Category:American accountants]] [[Category:People from Washington Parish, Louisiana]] [[Category:Politicians from New Orleans]] [[Category:Louisiana state senators]] [[Category:New Orleans City Council members]] [[Category:Louisiana Democrats]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New Orleans]] [[Category:American people of French descent]] [[Category:American people of German descent]] [[Category:20th-century American politicians]] [[Category:Burials at Metairie Cemetery]]

{{Infobox person | name = Monique Roosmale Nepveu | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Monique Louis Dreyfus | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1940}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = French | citizenship = | other_names = | known_for = minority shareholder of [[Louis Dreyfus Group]] | education = | net_worth = {{gain}} US$ 1.7 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] (August 2014)[https://www.forbes.com/profile/monique-louis-dreyfus/ Forbes: The World's Billionaires - Monique Louis Dreyfus] August 2014 | occupation = | spouse = Louis Jan Roosmale Nepveu | children = 2 | parents = Jean Louis-Dreyfus
Jeanne Madeline Depierre | relations = [[Marie-Jeanne Meyer]] {{small|(sister)}}
[[Robert Louis-Dreyfus]] {{small|(brother)}} }} '''Monique Roosmale Nepveu''' (born 1940) is a French billionaire and member of the Louis Dreyfus family. == Early life == Born Monique Louis-Dreyfus, she was one of three children born to Jean and Jeanne Madeline (née Depierre) Louis-Dreyfus. Her brother is [[Robert Louis-Dreyfus]] and her sister is [[Marie-Jeanne Meyer]].[http://www.whoswho.fr/decede/biographie-jean-louis-dreyfus_16958 Who's Who in France: "Biographie Jean Louis-dreyfus"] February 2, 2003Bourdon, Jean-Claude and Jacques-Olivier Martin ''Robert Louis-Dreyfus: Les aventures d'un Don Juan des affaires'' (2007), 293 pages, {{ISBN|2-35228-003-6}} Her father was [[French Jews|Jewish]] and her mother [[Roman Catholic]].[http://www.parismatch.com/Actu/Economie/Robert-Louis-Dreyfus-un-seigneur-qui-voyait-loin-et-visait-haut-140512 Paris Match: "“Robert Louis-Dreyfus, un seigneur qui voyait loin et visait haut" by Jacques Veyrat] July 8, 2009 (''in French'') | ''"...cet agnostique, fils d’un juif et d’une catholique..." / "...this agnostic, the son of a Jew and a Catholic..."'' She is the great granddaughter of [[Léopold Louis-Dreyfus]], founder of the [[Louis-Dreyfus Group]], which had begun buying and selling wheat in the [[Alsace]] region a century earlier, and rapidly diversified into shipping, oil and other commodities.{{cite news | title = Obituary: Robert Louis-Dreyfus: Businessman who helped resurrect Olympique Marseille football club | author = Pierre Perrone | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/robert-louisdreyfus-businessman-who-helped-resurrect-olympique-marseille-football-club-1749706.html | format = newspaper | agency = | newspaper = The Independent | publisher = Independent News and Media Limited | location = United Kingdom | date = 17 July 2009 | page = | pages = | at = | accessdate = | language = |trans-title=| quote = | archiveurl = | archivedate = | ref = }} Her grandfather was [[Louis Louis-Dreyfus]] who served in the [[French Parliament]] during the [[French Third Republic]].[http://www.senat.fr/senateur-3eme-republique/louis_dreyfus_louis0119r3.html Ancien sénateur des Alpes-Maritimes] August 17, 2013 After the death of her brother Robert, his widow and second wife [[Margarita Louis-Dreyfus]] (born Rita Bogdanova), inherited 60% of the [[Louis Dreyfus Group]][[:fr:Margarita Louis-Dreyfus|Margarita Louis-Dreyfus]], fr.wikipedia (later increased to 65% in 2012). Monique owns 12.5% of the Louis Dreyfus Group making her a billionaire.[https://www.forbes.com/sites/luisakroll/2012/11/07/rising-commodity-prices-created-three-louis-dreyfus-billionaires/ Forbes: "Rising Commodity Prices Created Three Louis-Dreyfus Billionaires" by Zohair Siraj] November 7, 2012[http://madame.lefigaro.fr/societe/margarita-louis-dreyfus-tsarine-affaires-270713-440620 Le Figaro: Margarita Louis-Dreyfus, la Tsarine des affaires"] 27 Juillet 2013 ==Personal life== She was married to Louis Jan "Jack" Roosmale Nepveu (August 8, 1928 – April 9, 2013). Her husband, a [[Dutch people|Dutch]] commoner born in [[Pretoria, South Africa]] was previously engaged to [[Princess Marie Louise of Bulgaria]] but the wedding did not take place.[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1338&dat=19531212&id=k_lXAAAAIBAJ&sjid=ivYDAAAAIBAJ&pg=4476,2046029 Spokane Daily Chronicle: "Princess to Wed"] December 12, 2953[http://royalmusingsblogspotcom.blogspot.com/2013/12/princess-marie-louise-to-wed.html Royal Musings: "Princess Marie Louise to wed "] December 12, 1953 They have two children. Actress [[Julia Louis-Dreyfus]] is her cousin. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roosmale Nepveu, Monique}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:French billionaires]] [[Category:Louis-Dreyfus family]] [[Category:Living people]]

'''Moshe Yanai''' ({{lang-he|משה ינאי}}; born 1949) is an [[Israelis|Israeli]] [[electrical engineer]]. He is an [[Patent|inventor]],<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20100815193122/http://www.prior-ip.com/search#2;inventors%253A%2522moshe+yanai%2522+ Moshe Yanai's patents at prior-ip.com] Retrieved 5-27-2011.</ref> businessman, [[entrepreneur]],<ref name=Calcalist2010/> [[aviator]] (pilot),<ref>[http://www.themarker.com/tmc/article.jhtml?ElementId=skira20100902_1187608 "הג'וב החדש של משה ינאי: יטיס אנשי עסקים במסוק - The new job of Moshe Yanai: Will fly businessmen by helicopter"] ''TheMarker'', September 2, 2010 (in Hebrew; for a printer friendly version click [http://www.themarker.com/ibo/misc/printFriendly.jhtml?ElementId=skira20100902_1187608 here]; for an English version use, e.g., Google Web-page translation). Retrieved 11-13-2010.</ref> [[investor]],<ref name=Calcalist2010/><ref name=Diligent1>[http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/emc-transfers-its-r-d-to-diligent-1.28649 "EMC transfers its R&D to Diligent"] ''HA'ARETZ'', November 12, 2002 (for a printer friendly version click [http://www.haaretz.com/misc/article-print-page/emc-transfers-its-r-d-to-diligent-1.28649?trailingPath=2.169%2C2.225%2C2.228%2C here]). Retrieved 11-13-2010.</ref> and [[philanthropist]].<ref>[http://www.focus.technion.ac.il/Oct10/newsStory6.htm "Mr Nice Guy"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110816232837/http://www.focus.technion.ac.il/Oct10/newsStory6.htm |date=2011-08-16 }} ''TechnionFOCUS'', October 2010. Retrieved 12-16-2010.</ref><ref name=Birds2011>[http://www.jpost.com/NationalNews/Article.aspx?id=197149 "New bird research fund to take flight next week"] ''The Jerusalem Post'' 11/29/2010.</ref> He led the development of the [[EMC Symmetrix]], the [[flagship product]] of [[EMC Corporation]] in the 1990s.
== Biography == Moshe Yanai was born in 1949 in [[Israel]], and earned a [[B.Sc.]] in electrical engineering in 1975 from [[Technion - Israel Institute of Technology]]. Yanai began his career building [[IBM mainframe|IBM-compatible mainframe]] [[Data storage device|data storage]] based on [[minicomputer]] [[Disk storage|disks]] for [[Elbit Systems]] (a joint project with [[Nixdorf Computer]]). He went on to develop high-end storage systems for Nixdorf in the [[United States]].
Yanai joined [[EMC Corporation]] in 1987, and managed the [[EMC Symmetrix|Symmetrix]] development, [[Computer software|software]] and [[Computer hardware|hardware]], from its inception in the late 1980s<ref name=AxxanaBoard>[http://www.axxana.com/Axxana/Templates/showpage.asp?DBID=1&LNGID=1&TMID=137&FID=807 Axxana board of directors] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100120065124/http://www.axxana.com/Axxana/Templates/showpage.asp?DBID=1&LNGID=1&TMID=137&FID=807 |date=2010-01-20 }} See Moshe Yanai. Retrieved 2-26-2011.</ref> until shortly before leaving EMC in 2001.<ref name=EMCfellow2001>EMC Company Web site, November 29, 2001: [http://www.emc.com/about/news/press/us/2001/20011129-1164.htm "EMC Strengthens Operational Alignment"] See paragraph about Moshe Yanai. Retrieved 10-24-2010.</ref> His development team grew from several people, recruited among his former Israeli colleagues, to thousands, while he was vice president.<ref name=AxxanaBoard/> EMC grew in the 1990s, both in size and value, from a company with a fading business of ([[minicomputer]]) [[computer memory]] [[Printed circuit board|boards]], valued in several millions of [[United States dollar|dollars]], to a hundreds-of-billions company.<ref>EMC Company Web site, July 19, 2000: [http://www.emc.com/about/news/press/us/earnings/20000719-469.htm "EMC Reports 43% Growth in Storage Revenue, First $2 Billion Quarter"] Retrieved 10-24-2010.</ref><ref>EMC Corp. at Yahoo Stock - Historical Prices [https://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=EMC+Interactive#] Retrieved 04-30-2015.</ref> Before leaving he became an EMC Fellow.<ref name=EMCfellow2001/>
Yanai funded and led an [[Israel]]i [[Computer storage|storage]] [[startup company]], XIV,<ref>[http://www.xivstorage.com/ XIV Storage Web site] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120919164845/http://www.xivstorage.com/ |date=2012-09-19 }} Retrieved 11-11-2010.</ref> which was bought by [[IBM]] in January 2008 (IBM paid an estimated $300 million for a company invested in with an estimated $3 million).<ref name=XIVIBM>[http://features.techworld.com/storage/3912/why-did-ibm-buy-xiv "Why did IBM buy XIV? IBM's XIV Purchase background"], ''TecWorld'', January 4, 2008. Retrieved 11-11-2010.</ref> Yanai continued leading XIV<ref>XIV Storage Web site: [http://www.xivstorage.com/about/about_profile.asp about] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119021225/http://www.xivstorage.com/about/about_profile.asp |date=2010-11-19 }} Retrieved 2-26-2011.</ref> and became an [[IBM Fellow]].<ref name=IBMfellow2008>IBM Company Web site: [http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/photo/24265.wss IBM Fellow Moshe Yanai], Retrieved 11-11-2010.</ref> The [[IBM XIV Storage System]] became an IBM storage product.<ref name=IBMXIV>IBM Company Web site: [http://www-03.ibm.com/systems/storage/disk/xiv/ IBM XIV Storage System] Retrieved 3-1-2011.</ref> Shortly later, in April 2008, IBM bought Diligent Technologies,<ref name=Diligent2>IBM Company Web site: Press release 18 April 2008 [http://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/23929.wss IBM Acquires Storage Company Diligent Technologies] Retrieved 3-1-2011.</ref> another storage company co-founded by Yanai.<ref name=Diligent1/> He left IBM in 2010.<ref name=Calcalist2010>[http://www.calcalist.co.il/local/articles/0,7340,L-3416970,00.html "ינאי נתן, ינאי לקח - Yanai gave, Yanai took"] ''Calcalist'', September 7, 2010 (In Hebrew; a printer friendly version [http://www.calcalist.co.il/Ext/Comp/ArticleLayout/CdaArticlePrintPreview/1,2506,L-3416970,00.html here]; for an English version use, e.g., Google Web-page translation). Retrieved 11-11-2010.</ref> In 2011 he founded [[Infinidat]], a [[computer data storage]] company. In April 2015, Infinidat announced a $150 million investment led by [[TPG Capital]].<ref>INFINIDAT Website, April 30, 2015: [http://www.infinidat.com/infinidat-announces-150-million-investment-led-by-tpg-eclipses-1b-valuation/ a $150 million investment "Infinidat Announces $150 Million Investment Led by TPG, Eclipses $1B Valuation"] Retrieved 04-30-2015.</ref> This investment placed it among the most valuable privately held companies.<ref>Wall Street Journal, April 30, 2015: [https://blogs.wsj.com/venturecapital/2015/04/29/data-storage-startup-infinidat-raises-150-million-at-1-2-billion-valuation/ "Data Storage Startup Infinidat Raises $150 Million at $1.2 Billion Valuation"] Retrieved 04-30-2015.</ref>
Yanai is an inventor or co-inventor of about 40 US patents in the field of electronic data storage.
In June 2011 his [[Alma mater]], [[Technion - Israel Institute of Technology]], awarded him the honor Distinguished Fellow of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, and in 2012, conferred upon him an Honorary Doctorate. He has been a [[board of directors]] member of several companies.<ref name=AxxanaBoard/> Also in 2011, Infinidat announced Moshe became its CEO.<ref>http://www.infinidat.com/news/press-releases/infinidat-announces-150-million-investment-led-by-tpg-eclipses-1b-valuation/</ref>
== Awards ==
* [[EMC Corporation|EMC]] Fellow – 2001<ref name=EMCfellow2001/> * [[IBM Fellow]] – 2008.<ref name=IBMfellow2008/> * [[IEEE Reynold B. Johnson Information Storage Systems Award]] – 2010<ref>[http://www.ieee.org/about/awards/bios/johnson_info_recipients.html IEEE Reynold B. Johnson Information Storage Systems Award - 2010 to Moshe Yanai] Retrieved 12-16-2010.</ref> * Distinguished Fellow of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, [[Technion - Israel Institute of Technology]] – 2011 * Honorary Doctorate, [[Technion - Israel Institute of Technology]] – 2012

{{Infobox film | name = Other People's Money | image = Other peoples money poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | screenplay = [[Alvin Sargent]] | based on = {{Based on|''Other People's Money'' (play)|[[Jerry Sterner]]}} | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Danny DeVito]] * [[Gregory Peck]] * [[Penelope Ann Miller]] * [[Piper Laurie]]}} | director = [[Norman Jewison]] | producer = [[Norman Jewison]]
Ric Kidney | music = [[David Newman (composer)|David Newman]] | cinematography = [[Haskell Wexler]] | editing = Hubert C. de la Bouillerie
[[Lou Lombardo (filmmaker)|Lou Lombardo]]
[[Michael Pacek]] | distributor = [[Warner Bros.]] | released = {{Film date|1991|10|18|United States|1991|11|15|United Kingdom}} | runtime = 103 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = $25,682,090{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=otherpeoplesmoney.htm |title=Other People's Money (1991) |website=Box Office Mojo |access-date=February 28, 2018}} }} '''''Other People's Money''''' is a 1991 American [[comedy-drama film|comedy-drama]] film starring [[Danny DeVito]], [[Gregory Peck]] and [[Penelope Ann Miller]]. It was based on the [[Play (theatre)|play]] of the same name by [[Jerry Sterner]]. The film adaptation was directed by award winner [[Norman Jewison]], and written by [[Alvin Sargent]]. ==Plot== Lawrence "Larry the Liquidator" Garfield ([[Danny DeVito]]) is a successful [[corporate raid]]er who has become rich buying up companies and selling off their assets. With the help of a computerized stock analyzing program called "Carmen", Garfield has identified New England Wire & Cable Company as his next target. The struggling company is run by the benevolent and folksy Andrew "Jorgy" Jorgenson ([[Gregory Peck]]) and is the primary employer in its small [[Rhode Island]] town in [[New England]]. The company is doing okay and stock is rising. Garfield decides to take over the company. After Jorgy learns that he has filed a [[Schedule 13D]] report, and after stubbornly insisting that no outsider can seize control of a business his father began, Jorgy is finally persuaded to hire his stepdaughter Kate ([[Penelope Ann Miller]]), a big-city lawyer, to defend against a hostile takeover. Garfield is instantly smitten with the beautiful Kate, although he is on to her tactics and does not waver from his goal of becoming the majority stockholder of New England Wire & Cable. Garfield tactlessly and unsuccessfully tries to seduce her. Despite their antagonism, Kate finds herself attracted to Garfield's bold nature. The takeover attempt begins to fracture the New England Wire & Cable Company family. Kate's mother Bea ([[Piper Laurie]]) secretly travels to Garfield's offices to offer one million dollars in [[greenmail]] to Garfield if he'll go away, but he refuses, stating, "I don't take money from widows or orphans." Trusted company president Bill Coles ([[Dean Jones (actor)|Dean Jones]]), fearful that the takeover will leave him with nothing, offers to let Garfield vote his shares in the company in exchange for a million-dollar payout. Garfield agrees, but specifies that Coles will get only half as much if his shares fail to make up the [[margin of victory]]. Garfield concedes to Jorgy's offer to let the matter be settled at the annual shareholder's meeting. Relying on the support of longtime friends and investors, Jorgy makes an impassioned plea to save the company, appealing to the traditions of manufacturing as opposed to the new breed of capitalism which Larry the Liquidator represents, in which buyers of companies create no products or jobs and are interested only in money. The shareholders seem swayed by Jorgy's speech and boo Garfield when he gets up to give a rebuttal. In his rebuttal, Garfield compares New England Wire & Cable to the last [[buggy whip]] manufacturer, arguing that even though the company's product may be high quality, changing technology has rendered it obsolete. Rather than running a failing business into the ground, he contends that the shareholders should follow his lead and get what value they can from the stock before the company's inevitable demise. At least when this company is liquidated, he says, they'll end up with a few dollars in their pocket. When the vote is taken, the shareholders agree to give Garfield controlling interest in the company. The margin of victory is greater than Coles' shares and thus he does not receive the full amount he betrayed Jorgy to get. Back at home in Manhattan, Garfield finds himself uncharacteristically despondent after his victory, having realized he has lost his chance for a romance with Kate. Just then, Kate calls. She's been having discussions with a [[Japan]]ese automaker that wants to hire New England Wire & Cable to manufacture stainless steel wire cloth for making automobile [[airbag]]s, something which will make the company profitable again on a new expanding industrial product. An excited Garfield invites her to dinner to discuss it. ==Cast== *[[Danny DeVito]] as Lawrence ("Larry the Liquidator") Garfield *[[Gregory Peck]] as Andrew ("Jorgy") Jorgenson *[[Penelope Ann Miller]] as Kate Sullivan *[[Piper Laurie]] as Bea Sullivan *[[Dean Jones (actor)|Dean Jones]] as Bill Coles *[[R. D. Call]] as Arthur *[[Mo Gaffney]] as Harriet *[[Tom Aldredge]] as Ozzie ==Production== {{Unreferenced|section|date=February 2015}} Some of the scenes that take place inside the factory were shot in the now defunct "Seymour Specialty and Wire" in [[Seymour, Connecticut|Seymour]], [[Connecticut]]. Also Known As: Reactive Metals Inc., National Distillers and Chemical Co. and Bridgeport Brass Co., Seymour, Connecticut. Other scenes were shot in the (also defunct) Gilbert and Bennett mill in [[Georgetown, Connecticut|Georgetown]], Connecticut. ==Reception== The film received mixed to negative reviews, with a 31% rating on review aggregate [[Rotten Tomatoes]] based on 16 reviews.{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/other_peoples_money/|title=Other People's Money|date=18 October 1991|publisher=Rottentomatoes.com|accessdate=24 November 2014}} [[Roger Ebert]] of ''[[The Chicago Sun-Times]]'' gave the film 3.5 out of 4 stars, but said 'I didn’t like the very last scene of “Other People’s Money.” It felt tacked on, manufactured, concocted out of a Hollywood studio’s knee-jerk need to provide a smileyface ending that was not in the spirit of the film'.{{cite web|url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/other-peoples-money-1991|title=Other People's Money|author=Roger Ebert|date=18 October 1991|publisher=Rogerebert.com|accessdate=24 November 2014}} [[Janet Maslin]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' said of Sargent's adaptation, 'culminates in a speechy but effective debate about the merits of old-fashioned business versus the corporate takeover,' but still felt that the film was 'too genial to be hard-hitting.'{{cite web|authorlink=Janet Maslin|author=Maslin, Janet|url=https://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9D0CE0D91431F93BA25753C1A967958260|title=Review/Film; DeVito as a Corporate Raider With Cuddly Charm|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=24 November 2014}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote}} * {{IMDb title|id=0102609|title=Other People's Money}} * {{tcmdb title|85908|Other People's Money}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|other_peoples_money|Other People's Money}} * {{amg title|id=36715|title=Other People's Money}} * {{Mojo title|otherpeoplesmoney|Other People's Money}} * [http://www.americanrhetoric.com/MovieSpeeches/moviespeechotherpeoplesmoneypeck.html AmericanRhetoric.com audio and text of Jorgy Jorgenson's (Gregory Peck) speech to NE Wire and Cable shareholders' meeting] * [http://www.americanrhetoric.com/MovieSpeeches/moviespeechotherpeoplesmoneydevito.html AmericanRhetoric.com video and text of Larry "The Liquidator" Garfield's (Danny DeVito) speech to NE Wire and Cable shareholders' meeting] {{Norman Jewison}} [[Category:1991 films]] [[Category:1990s comedy-drama films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American business films]] [[Category:American comedy-drama films]] [[Category:Trading films]] [[Category:Films directed by Norman Jewison]] [[Category:American films based on plays]] [[Category:Warner Bros. films]] [[Category:Films set in Rhode Island]] [[Category:Films shot in Connecticut]] [[Category:Corporate raiders]] [[Category:Wall Street films]] [[Category:Films scored by David Newman]] [[Category:Screenplays by Alvin Sargent]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2017}} {{Use British English|date=October 2017}} {{More citations needed|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox company | name = Rail Delivery Group | logo = [[File:Rail_Delivery_Group_logo.svg|right|250px]] | predecessor = Association of Train Operating Companies, Rail Delivery Group | successor = | defunct = | fate = | industry = [[Rail transport]] | parent = | foundation = 24 October 2017 | location = [[London]], [[England]], [[United Kingdom|UK]] }}
The '''Rail Delivery Group''' ('''RDG''') is the [[Rail transport in Great Britain|United Kingdom rail industry]] membership body that brings together passenger and freight rail companies, [[Network Rail]] and [[High Speed 2]].
==History== From 24 October 2017, RDG replaced: * The '''Association of Train Operating Companies''' ('''ATOC'''), comprising the passenger train operating companies. ATOC was set up by the train operators to ensure nationwide services – such as ticket acceptance and railcards – continued after the privatisation of the railways under the [[Railways Act 1993]]. * The former Rail Delivery Group, formed in 2011 to formulate policy and undertake communications on behalf of the entire rail industry. At first the group's members were the major passenger and freight train operator groups, together with [[Network Rail]]; membership was widened to all mainline passenger and freight operators in 2013.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.raildeliverygroup.com/about-us.html|title=About us|last=|first=|date=|website=Rail Delivery Group|language=en-gb|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=13 August 2018}}</ref>
The new RDG is owned by its members, which are: * Network Rail, the nationalised owner of the rail infrastructure *[[High Speed 2|HS2]] *The [[train operating company|train operating companies]] that provide passenger services *The [[freight operating company|freight operating companies]] *The [[Rail Supply Group]] (RSG)
The new RDG owns both the [[National Rail]] and 'Britain Runs on Rail' brands.
The company's legal name continues to be ATOC Limited.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/03069033|title=ATOC Limited|last=|first=|date=|website=Companies House|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=13 August 2018}}</ref>
==Main operations== * Revenue allocation and settlement through [[ORCATS]] systems * [[National Rail Enquiries]] * [[Railcard]] marketing * Staff travel arrangements for current and retired train company staff * International products, such as Britrail and [[Interrail]] * The relationship with [[Transport for London]] * The licensing of third party ticket sellers, such as [[Travel agency|travel agents]] and online sellers such as [[The Trainline]] and Red Spotted Hanky * Sponsorship of the [[Plusbus]] and Cycle-Rail schemes * Railway policy formulation * Industry communications with the public It also produces the definitive [[National Routeing Guide]], defining the validity of tickets, and has some input in the content of the ''[[National Fares Manual]]'', which is distributed by the National Rail website. It works with RSG to coordinate shared objectives.
==European equivalents== As rail franchising also takes place in other countries, most European countries have one or more equivalent organisation.
In Germany, the ''[[:de:Tarifverband_der_Bundeseigenen_und_Nichtbundeseigenen_Eisenbahnen_in_Deutschland|Tarifverband der Bundeseigenen und Nichtbundeseigenen Eisenbahnen in Deutschland]]'' (Tariff Association of Federal and Non-Federal Railways in Germany; TBNE) is responsible for railway ticket revenue distribution. Political representation of TOCs is carried out by ''[[mofair e.V.]]''
In Sweden, the equivalent organisation is the ''[[Branschföreningen Tågoperatörerna]]'' (Association of Swedish Train Operating Companies).

'''Raoul Weil''' (born 13 November 1959) is a [[Swiss banker]]. Weil is best known as being the former Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Global Wealth Management & Business Banking at [[UBS AG]]. Weil eventually became a member of UBS's Group Executive Board.
During Weil’s tenure at UBS, the Bank became embroiled in the [[UBS tax evasion controversy|2008-09 U.S. tax evasion controversy]], which led to Weil’s voluntary departure from the Bank after he was indicted by the [[United States Department of Justice|U.S. Justice Department]] for allegedly offering help to thousands of UBS’s U.S. clients who failed to pay their federal income taxes. Arrested in October 2013 during a trip to Italy, Weil has been extradited to the United States.<ref name="Swiss banker in eye">{{cite news|last=Jucca|first=Lisa and Valentina Accardo|title=Swiss banker in eye of U.S. tax evasion storm to face court|url=https://news.yahoo.com/swiss-banker-eye-u-tax-evasion-storm-face-133139948--sector.html|accessdate=16 December 2013|newspaper=Reuters|date=16 December 2013}}</ref> On December 16, 2013, Weil was released on $10.5 million bail by the federal district court in [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]].<ref name="Florida judge grants bail">{{cite news|last=Fagenson|first=Zachary|title=Florida judge grants $10.5 million bail for ex-UBS banker|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/16/us-banker-extradition-tax-bail-idUSBRE9BF16Q20131216|accessdate=17 December 2013|newspaper=Reuters|date=16 December 2013}}</ref> The trial began in Ft. Lauderdale on October 14, 2014 and the jury found him not guilty on November 3, 2014.
==Early life== Weil was born in Switzerland. Weil graduated from the University of Basel with a degree in economics.<ref name="Weil Arrested in Italy">{{cite news|last=Martinuzzi|first=Elisa|title=Fugitive Ex-UBS Wealth Management Chief Weil Arrested in Italy|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-10-21/fugitive-ex-ubs-wealth-management-chief-weil-arrested-in-italy.html|newspaper=Bloomberg|date=21 October 2013}}</ref> He also earned a masters in economics with a specialization in national economics and business administration.
== Charitable Activities== Raoul Weil is a member of the Optimus Foundation, a charitable foundation administered by UBS which helps with disease prevention and education across the world. In 2008, Weil was elected chairman of the Optimus Foundation’s board, pledging the foundation to the goal of becoming the largest charitable organization in Switzerland in the next decade.<ref name="Weil Elected Chairman of Optimus">{{cite journal|title=With vigor into the future|url=http://www.ubs.com/global/en/wealth_management/optimusfoundation/downloads/_jcr_content/par/table_2728.186018188.file/dGFibGVUZXh0PS9jb250ZW50L2RhbS91YnMvZ2xvYmFsL3dlYWx0aF9tYW5hZ2VtZW50L29wdGltdXNmb3VuZGF0aW9uLzEzMzU0N19VQlNfT3B0aW11c19lLnBkZg==/133547_UBS_Optimus_e.pdf|publisher=UBS Optimus World|date=January 2008}}</ref>
In September 2008, Weil led the Global UBS Philanthropy Forum, which brought together philanthropists, business leaders, social entrepreneurs, and representatives from civil society from around the world to consider the theme of “Building Change Communities.”<ref name="UBS Philanthropy Forum brought to Asia for first time">{{cite news|title=Global UBS Philanthropy Forum brought to Asia for the first time|url=http://www.ubs.com/global/en/about_ubs/about_us/news/news.html/en/2008/09/12/2008_09_12.html|publisher=UBS|date=12 September 2008}}</ref>
==Banking career== After he finished active duty in the Swiss military in 1984, Weil was hired by the [[Swiss Bank Corporation]] (SBC), and worked in SBC's private banking division in [[Basel]], [[Zurich]], [[Monaco]], [[New York City]], and [[Hong Kong]] from 1984 until 1998. When SBC and UBS merged in 1998, Weil joined UBS as part of its private banking division for Asia and Europe, becoming head of UBS's Wealth Management International unit in 2002. In July 2007, Weil became CEO of WM&BB.<ref name="Weil Declared Fugitive">{{cite news|last=Kolker|first=Carlyn|title=Ex-UBS Executive Raoul Weil Declared a Fugitive by U.S. Judge|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aSEvhPR7Ok6A|newspaper=Bloomberg|date=14 January 2009}}</ref>
On November 12, 2008, Weil voluntarily relinquished his duties with UBS to focus on his defense after being indicted in connection with the ongoing investigation of UBS's US cross-border business by the [[United States Department of Justice]].<ref name="Statement on Indictment of UBS Executive">{{cite web|url=http://www.ubs.com/global/en/about_ubs/media/global/releases/news_display_media_global.html/en/2008/11/12/2008_11_12.html|title=Statement On Indictment Of UBS Executive|publisher=UBS|date=12 November 2008}}</ref> The United States issued an international arrest warrant for Weil in 2008.
On May 23, 2008, the Swiss Federal Banking Commission (EBK, the predecessor to FINMA) opened an investigation into UBS’s role in facilitating tax evasion by its US clients. The EBK concluded, among other things, that UBS’s “top management” was not aware of the Bank’s US clients’ fraudulent conduct, and were not “accessories or accomplices” to UBS’s violations.<ref name="EBK investigation of UBS business with US private clients">{{cite web|url=http://www.finma.ch/d/aktuell/Documents/kurzbericht-ubs-x-border-20090218-e.pdf|title=EBK investigation of the cross-border business of UBS AG with its private clients in the USA|publisher=FINMA|date=18 February 2009}}</ref> The EBK also found that the US cross-border business’s managers at the time – Martin Liechti and Michel Guignard<ref name="US Senate Staff Report on Tax Haven Banks">{{cite web|url=TAX HAVEN BANKS AND U. S. TAX COMPLIANCE: Staff Report|title=|publisher=US Senate|date=July 17, 2008}}</ref> – were the principal architects of UBS’s wrongdoing and had actively concealed their misconduct from Weil.<ref name="EBK investigation of UBS business with US private clients"/>
After leaving UBS, Weil was hired as a consultant in 2010 by Reuss Private Group ([[Pfäffikon, Schwyz]], Switzerland), eventually becoming a managing partner.<ref name="Italian police arrest fugitive">{{cite news|title=Italian police arrest ‘fugitive’ Swiss banker|url=http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/business/Italian_police_arrest_fugitive_Swiss_banker_.html?cid=37154608|accessdate=16 December 2013|newspaper=International Service of the Swiss Broadcasting Corporation|date=21 October 2013}}</ref> At the beginning of 2013, he succeeded [[Adriano B. Lucatelli]] as chief executive officer of Reuss Private Group.<ref>{{cite web|title=Response to the arrest of Raoul Weil|url=http://www.frank-cs.org/cms/pdfs/CH/RPG/RPG_Weil_PressRelease_21.10.13.pdf|publisher=Reuss Private Group|accessdate=16 December 2013}}</ref> In February 2013, FINMA granted Reuss a license to deal in securities and certified that Reuss management, including Weil, was engaged in “proper business conduct” (Gewähr für eine einwandfreie Geschäftstätigkeit). As part of the application process, Weil confirmed in writing that he had not concealed anything with respect to the US-UBS tax dispute.<ref>{{cite web|title=Verhafteter Banker hatte Persilschein der Finma|url=http://bazonline.ch/wirtschaft/unternehmen-und-konjunktur/Verhafteter-Banker-hatte-Persilschein-der-Finma/story/25021011|publisher=Tages Anzeiger|date=21 October 2013}}</ref>
On December 2, 2013, Weil was replaced by Felix Brem as CEO of Reuss Private Group.<ref name="Felix Brem new CEO of Reuss Private Group">{{cite web|title=Felix Brem new CEO of Reuss Private Group|url=http://reussprivategroup.com/uploads/media/RPG_CEO_131202_eng.pdf|accessdate=27 June 2014|publisher=Reuss Private Group}}</ref>
==US Tax Evasion Controversy== {{main article|UBS tax evasion controversy}} In 2008, the U.S. [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] began probing a multimillion-dollar [[UBS tax evasion controversy|tax evasion]] case involving UBS due to disclosures made by [[Brad Birkenfeld]], a former UBS banker in Switzerland, who was arrested entering the United States and cooperated with the US [[United States Department of Justice|Department of Justice]], the US [[Securities and Exchange Commission]], and the US [[Internal Revenue Service]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jTfwAG7pDZAUUS8_feZQgnnHAeaQ |title=AFP: FBI 'to probe Swiss bank UBS' in tax dodging case |publisher=[[Google News]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=June 22, 2008 |accessdate=July 11, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140107001519/https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jTfwAG7pDZAUUS8_feZQgnnHAeaQ |archivedate=January 7, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whistleblowers.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1036|title=National Whistleblowers Center – Bradley Birkenfeld Fact Sheet |publisher=[[Whistleblowers]].org|date=August 21, 2009|accessdate=May 24, 2012}}</ref> Concurrently, a [[United States Senate]] subcommittee accused Swiss banks, including UBS, of helping wealthy Americans evade taxes through [[offshore account]]s, which it estimated cost of the U.S. excess of US$100 billion annually.<ref name="UBS Says It Won’t Turn Over More Names in IRS Suit">{{cite web|last=Voreacos, Donmoyer|first=David, Ryan|title=UBS Says It Won’t Turn Over More Names in IRS Suit|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aWDQWshGiCig|publisher=Bloomberg L.P.|accessdate=29 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/banking_and_finance/article4348822.ece|title=US Senate claims UBS 'colluded' behind Swiss bank secrecy laws|work=The Times|accessdate=February 20, 2009|place=London|first1=Miles|last1=Costello|date=July 17, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121624391105859731?mod=googlenews_wsj|title=Offshore Tax Evasion Costs U.S. $100 billion, Senate Probe of UBS and LGT indicates|work=The Wall Street Journal|date=July 17, 2008|accessdate=February 20, 2009|first=Evan|last=Perez}}</ref>
In response, UBS announced that it would cease providing cross-border private banking services to US-domiciled clients through its non-US regulated units as of July 2008.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/portal/site/home/permalink/?ndmViewId=news_view&newsId=20081112006425&newsLang=en|title=Statement on Indictment of UBS Executive|publisher=[[BusinessWire]]|accessdate=November 12, 2008}}</ref>
As part of its investigation into the conduct of UBS’s US cross-border business, DOJ demanded client banking records from UBS. Under Swiss bank secrecy laws, UBS was prohibited from turning over such documents. The Swiss government interceded and began negotiating with DOJ in an effort to persuade DOJ to stop trying to force UBS to violate Swiss law. On November 6, 2008, a U.S. federal grand jury indicted Raoul Weil in connection with the ongoing investigation of UBS,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/3aa635bc-b124-11dd-8915-0000779fd18c,Authorised=false.html?_i_location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ft.com%2Fcms%2Fs%2F0%2F3aa635bc-b124-11dd-8915-0000779fd18c.html%3Fnclick_check%3D1&_i_referer=&nclick_check=1|title=UBS suffers offshore blow as US indicts wealth management head|work=Financial Times|accessdate=November 13, 2008}}</ref> and DOJ obtained an order from the court there placing the indictment under seal. On November 10, 2008, Swiss Finance Minister Hans-Rudolf Merz and Head of the Swiss Federal Department of Justice and Police Eveline Widmer-Schlumpf sent a letter to U.S. Attorney General Michael Mukasey and Treasury Secretary Henry Paulsen asking that DOJ go through the information-sharing provisions of the US-Switzerland Double Taxation Treaty if it wanted to obtain information regarding UBS’s clients. Weil’s indictment was unsealed two days later, on November 12, 2008. According to one high-level Swiss source, “[t]hat was a clear message . . . One can imagine that without the letter they would have at least delayed the indictment of Weil.”<ref>{{cite news|url=https://af.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idAFTRE63823U20100409?pageNumber=4&virtualBrandChannel=0|title=How the U.S. cracked open secret vaults at UBS|publisher=Reuters|date=April 9, 2010}}</ref>
Weil soon thereafter left the Bank to focus on the criminal case. On February 18, 2009, UBS agreed to pay a fine of US$780 million to the U.S. government and entered into a [[deferred prosecution agreement]] on charges of conspiring to defraud the United States by impeding the [[Internal Revenue Service]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601087&sid=a_TaQP5WVZuA&refer=home|title=UBS Will Pay $780 million to Settle U.S. Tax Claims, Bloomberg.com website (18 Feb 2009)|publisher=Bloomberg |date=May 30, 2005|accessdate=February 20, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usdoj.gov/opa/pr/2009/February/09-tax-136.html|title=UBS Enters into Deferred Prosecution Agreement|publisher=US Department of Justice|date=February 18, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/19/business/worldbusiness/19ubs.html?hp|title=A Swiss Bank Is Set to Open Its Secret Files|date=February 19, 2009|work=The New York Times|accessdate=February 19, 2009|first=Lynnley|last=Browning}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/litigation/litreleases/2009/lr20905.htm |title=U.S. SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION Litigation Release No. 20905 / February 18, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130103115944/http://www.sec.gov/litigation/litreleases/2009/lr20905.htm |archivedate=January 3, 2013 }} Retrieved on July 11, 2014.</ref> Weil’s charges were not dismissed as part of UBS’s deal, and he continued to face charges even after UBS had settled its criminal case and a subsequent dispute with the US government and IRS in the Fall of 2009, which resulted in UBS’s agreeing to turn over thousands of US customer files to the US.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/19/business/worldbusiness/19ubs.html?hp&_r=0|title=A Swiss Bank Is Set to Open Its Secret Files|newspaper=New York Times|date=February 18, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/11/18/business/global/18irs.html|title=14,700 Disclosed Offshore Accounts|newspaper=New York Times|date=November 17, 2009}}</ref>
On 6 January 2014, the National Whistleblowers Center claimed that Weil "will make a sweetheart deal with the DOJ" because he has "information that would be extremely embarrassing to wealthy and powerful people" in the United States and elsewhere."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.whistleblowersblog.org/2014/01/articles/tax-whistleblowers/federal-court-hearing-scheduled-for-ubs-tax-fraud-kingpin-raoul-weil/|title=Federal Court Hearing Scheduled for UBS Tax Fraud Kingpin Raoul Weil| publisher=Whistleblowers Protection Blog|date=6 January 2014}}</ref> Notwithstanding this claim, no such deal has apparently been reached. Weil is preparing for trial.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/moneybeat/2014/02/07/ex-ubs-executive-weil-faces-eight-month-wait-as-u-s-trial-delayed/|title=Ex-UBS Executive Weil Faces Eight-Month Wait as U.S. Trial Delayed| publisher=The Wall Street Journal|date= February 7, 2014}}</ref>
==Legal Issues==
Weil was declared a fugitive by Judge James Cohn on January 13, 2009.<ref>[https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601087&sid=aSEvhPR7Ok6A&refer=home "Ex-UBS Executive Raoul Weil Named Fugitive by U.S. Judge" Bloomberg News, 14 January 2009]</ref> Weil has maintained his innocence of the charges against him. Weil, who remained in Switzerland, his home country and place of residence, after being indicted, maintains that he did not run from the United States.<ref name="Florida judge grants bail"/>
===Extradition to U.S.===
On October 19, 2013, Weil was arrested in [[Bologna]], [[Italy]] while on a trip from Switzerland.<ref>"Ex-manager svizzero Ubs accusato di frode fiscale arrestato a Bologna", Oct. 9, 2013, la Repubblica, at [http://bologna.repubblica.it/cronaca/2013/10/20/news/manager_svizzero_accusato_di_frode_fiscale_arrestato_a_bologna-69001372/?ref=HREC1-10]</ref><ref>Elisa Martinuzzi & Elena Logutenkova, "Fugitive Ex-UBS Wealth Management Chief Weil Arrested in Italy," Oct. 21, 2013, Bloomberg News, at [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-10-21/fugitive-ex-ubs-wealth-management-chief-weil-arrested-in-italy.html].</ref> Weil's request for house arrest was turned down by Italian authorities,<ref name="Judge rejects house arrest bid">{{cite news|last=Jucca|first=Lisa|title=Judge rejects house arrest bid by jailed ex-UBS banker: source|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/17/us-banker-arrest-ubs-idUSBRE9AG04U20131117|accessdate=17 December 2013|date=17 November 2013}}</ref> and Weil decided not to contest extradition to the United States.<ref name="Swiss banker in eye" /> Weil's willingness to return to the U.S. raised the suspicion that he may have been offered a "sweetheart deal" by the U.S. Department of Justice, which treated another UBS conspirator, [[Martin Liechti]], extremely leniently, according to Bradley Birkenfeld's lawyer, [[Stephen M. Kohn]] of the [[National Whistleblower Center]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Whistleblower Fears UBS Banker Raoul Weil Will Get Sweetheart Deal|url=http://www.whistleblowers.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1448&Itemid=71|publisher=National Whistleblower Center|date=16 December 2013}}</ref>
Birkenfeld worked several levels below Weil at UBS, and apparently did not know him. According to Kohn, Weil "knows where all the skeletons are buried. Kohn claims that, "Weil can clearly bargain inside information he has that could be embarrassing to American officials or institutions for leniency."<ref>{{cite news|title=Ex-UBS bank executive to enter plea in tax fraud case|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/01/07/uk-ubs-tax-banker-idUKBREA0606620140107|publisher=Reuters UK|date=7 January 2014}}</ref>
Weil has said in filings with the court that the wrongdoing was committed by people below him, who concealed their own misconduct from Weil. He has also contended that the EBK investigation and decision exonerating Weil confirm that version of events.<ref>{{cite news|title=US-Recht in der Schweiz|url=http://www.weltwoche.ch/ausgaben/2014-26/us-recht-in-der-schweiz-die-weltwoche-ausgabe-262014.html|publisher=Die Weltwoche|date=30 June 2014}}</ref>
===Arraignment and Trial===
Charged with conspiracy to defraud the IRS in his appearance before the federal district court in [[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] on 16, December 2013, Weil was released on bail under house arrest with friends in New Jersey by US Magistrate Judge Patrick Hunt.<ref name="Florida judge grants bail"/> At his January 7, 2014 arraignment, Weil pleaded not-guilty to helping U.S. taxpayers evade taxes on $20 billion in offshore assets.
The trial began in Ft. Lauderdale on October 14, 2014 and the jury found him not guilty on November 3, 2014.<ref name="Ex-UBS Executive Weil Acquitte">{{cite web|last1=Nesmith|first1=Susanah and David Voreacos|title=Ex-UBS Executive Weil Acquitted of U.S. Tax Conspiracy|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-11-03/ex-ubs-executive-weil-acquitted-of-u-s-tax-conspiracy.html|website=BloombergBusiness.com|publisher=Bloomberg|accessdate=2 January 2015}}</ref> Jurors deliberated just over an hour before returning a not guilty verdict. The acquittal is final as prosecution cannot appeal in this case.

{{Infobox law enforcement agency | agencyname = Regional Economic Intelligence Committee | nativename = | nativenamea = | nativenamer = | commonname = | patch = | patchcaption = | logo = Emblem of India.svg | logocaption = | badge = | badgecaption = | flag = | flagcaption = | imagesize = 200 | motto = | mottotranslated = | mission = | formed = | preceding1 = | employees = | volunteers = | budget = | country = India | federal = Yes | map = | mapcaption = | sizearea = | sizepopulation = | legaljuris = | governingbody = Government of India | governingbodyscnd = | constitution1 = | restriction = | overviewtype = | overviewbody = | headquarters = [[New Delhi]], [[India]] | hqlocmap = | hqlocleft = | hqloctop = | hqlocmappoptitle = | sworntype = | sworn = | unsworntype = | unsworn = | electeetype = | minister1name = | minister1pfo = | chief1name = | chief1position = [[Chairman]] | parentagency = Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue | website = http://finmin.nic.in/ | child1agency = | unittype = | unitname = | officetype = committee | officename = | stationtype = | stations = }} The ''' Regional Economic Intelligence Committee''' is the apex forum overseeing government agencies responsible for [[Economic warfare|economic]] [[Intelligence (information gathering)|intelligence]] and combating economic offenses in the respective states of India. The Committee is under the [[Economic Intelligence Council]].<ref name="EIC">{{cite web|title=Economic Intelligence Council|url=http://www.ceib.nic.in/eic.htm#eic_role|publisher=[[National Informatics Centre]]|accessdate=2009-07-18}}</ref> It was formed in 1990.<ref name="FM">{{cite journal|title=Central Economic Intelligence Bureau - Ministry of Finance|url=http://finmin.nic.in/the_ministry/dept_eco_affairs/budget/annual_report/9596rev5.PDF|publisher=[[Ministry of Finance (India)|Ministry of Finance]]|accessdate=2009-07-18|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716105941/http://finmin.nic.in/the_ministry/dept_eco_affairs/budget/annual_report/9596rev5.PDF|archivedate=2011-07-16|df=}}</ref> The head of the committee is usually the Director General of the [[Directorate General of Income Tax Investigation]].<ref>http://www.business-standard.com/search?type=news&q=CEIB</ref>
==Members== * Director General of Income Tax '''(Chairman)''' * Chief Commissioner of Income Tax * Commissioner of Income Tax-1 * Director of Income Tax Intelligence * Director of Income Tax Investigation * Director of Income Tax Criminal Investigation * Director General of Police * Inspector General of Police (Economic Offenses) * Superintendent or DIG or Joint Director of [[Central Bureau of Investigation|CBI]] * Zonal Director [[Narcotics Control Bureau]] * Representation from [[Lokayukta]] * [[RBI]] Regional Manager * Joint Director General of Foreign Trade * Chief Commissioner of [[Central Board of Excise and Customs|Customs & Central Excise/Goods & Service Tax]] * Commissioner of [[Central Board of Excise and Customs|Customs and Central Excise/Goods & Service Tax]] * Additional Director General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) * Commissioner of [[Commercial Tax]] * DIG [[CRPF]] * DIG [[CISF]] * Additional Director General of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) * [[Additional Commissioners of Income Tax]] '''(Nodal Secretary)'''<ref>http://www.ceib.nic.in/ceib.htm</ref>
Members vary from state to state.
==Heads/Chairmen in various states== *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Ahmedabad]] - region of Ahmedabad in the state of [[Gujarat]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Bangalore]] - region of [[Karnataka]] and [[Goa]] in the state of [[Karnataka]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Customs and Central Excise/Goods & Service Tax, [[Vadodara]] - region of Vadodara, [[Surat]] and [[Rajkot]] in the state of Gujarat.<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Customs and Central Excise/Goods & Service Tax, [[Bhopal]] - region of Bhopal, [[Indore]], [[Raipur]] and [[Jabalpur]] in the states of [[Madhya Pradesh]] and [[Chhattisgarh]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Commissioner of Income Tax [[Bhubaneswar]] - region of Bhubaneswar in the state of [[Odisha]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Director General of Income Tax, [[Mumbai]] - region of Mumbai in the state of [[Maharashtra]] and the state of [[Goa]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Kolkata]] - region of Kolkata in the state of [[West Bengal]]. *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Chandigarh]] - region of Chandigarh, [[Rohtak]], [[Amritsar]], [[Jalandhar]] and [[Patiala]] in the state of [[Punjab (India)|Punjab]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Kochi, India|Kochi]] - region of Kochi, [[Thiruvananthapuram]] and [[Kozhikode|Calicut]] in the state of [[Kerala]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Delhi]] - region of [[Delhi]]. *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh|Hyderabad]] - region of Hyderabad, [[Visakhapatnam]] and [[Guntur]] in the state of [[Andhra Pradesh]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Jaipur]] - region of Jaipur in the state of [[Rajasthan]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Kanpur]] - region of Kanpur, [[Allahabad]], [[Lucknow]], [[Agra]] and [[Meerut]] in the state of [[Uttar Pradesh]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Director General of Income Tax (Investigation), [[Chennai]] - region of Chennai in the state of [[Tamil Nadu]]<ref name="EIC" /> *Commissioner of Customs, [[Madurai]] - region of Madurai and [[Coimbatore]] in the state of Tamil Nadu. *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Patna]] - region of [[Patna]] and [[Ranchi]] in the states of [[Bihar]] and [[Jharkhand]] respectively.<ref name="EIC" /> *Chief Commissioner of Income Tax, [[Pune]] - region of Pune, [[Aurangabad, Maharashtra|Aurangabad]], [[Belgaum]], [[Kolhapur]], [[Nasik]] and [[Nagpur]] in the state of [[Maharashtra]].<ref name="EIC" /> *Commissioner of Customs (Preventive), [[Shillong]] - region of Shillong in the state of [[Meghalaya]].<ref name="EIC" /><ref>http://dor.gov.in/ceib</ref>

{{Infobox officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = Ricky Vargas | image = PSC Hall of Fame awarding 2018 Vargas (cropped).jpg | honorific-suffix = | imagesize = | smallimage = | caption = Vargas in 2018 | order = 10th | office = President of the Philippine Olympic Committee | term_start = March 5, 2018 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Jose Cojuangco Jr.]] | successor = | order1 = | office1 = | term_start1 = | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = | successor1 = | birth_name = {{nowrap|Victorico P. Vargas}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1952|02|24}} | birth_place = Philippines<ref>{{cite web|title=Victorico P. Vargas|url=http://www.asbcnews.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/Victorico-P.-Vargas.pdf|publisher=Asian Boxing Confederation|accessdate=22 February 2018}}</ref> | alma_mater = [[University of Santo Tomas]] | spouse = | relations = [[Jorge B. Vargas]] (grandfather) | children = }} '''Victorico "Ricky" P. Vargas''' (born February 24, 1952<ref>{{cite web|title=Vargas: from corporate job to running Philippine sports|url=http://ec2-54-151-223-8.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com/generalsports/news/2018/02/23/vargas-corporate-job-running-philippine-sports-38061|website=ABS-CBN News|accessdate=24 February 2018|date=23 February 2018}}</ref>) is the 10th President of the [[Philippine Olympic Committee]] (POC) since March 5, 2018 after winning over Jose Cojuangco Jr. in a court-ordered elections held in February 23, 2018.
He is also the President of the Association of Boxing Alliances in the Philippines (ABAP) and the chairman of the [[Philippine Basketball Association]] Board of Governors for the [[2017–18 PBA season|2017–18 season]].
At [[PLDT]], Vargas is currently served as the Head of the company's Business Transformation Group.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.pldt.com/news-center/article/2018/01/24/pldt-smart-ink-seven-year-us$300m-deal-with-amdocs#.WpUB3FWWbIU|title=PLDT, Smart ink seven-year US$300M deal with Amdocs|publisher=PLDT|date=January 24, 2018|accessdate=February 27, 2018}}</ref>
==Education== Vargas studied at [[Ateneo de Manila University]] and the [[University of Santo Tomas]]. He is a holder of a bachelor's degree in psychology.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vargas, Victorico|url=https://www.reuters.com/finance/stocks/officer-profile/TEL.PS/156733|accessdate=23 February 2018|agency=Reuters}}</ref>
==Career== ===Sports administration=== He served as the [[Philippine Basketball Association]] chairman of the board of governors for the [[2006–07 PBA season|2006–07]] and [[2017–18 PBA season|2017–18 season]] representing [[TNT KaTropa]] as its team governor,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sports.inquirer.net/276117/ricky-vargas-new-pba-chairman|title=Ricky Vargas is new PBA chairman|publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|last=Leongson|first=Randolph B.|date=December 17, 2017|accessdate=February 23, 2018}}</ref> and the president of [[Association of Boxing Alliances in the Philippines]], the NSA for Boxing in the [[Philippines]]. He is also the former Vice Chairman of the [[Samahang Basketbol ng Pilipinas]] (SBP)<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/09/01/15/sbp-exec-meet-lakers-officials-clarksons-dad-report|title=SBP exec to meet Lakers officials, Clarkson's dad: report|publisher=[[ABS-CBN News]]|date=September 1, 2015|accessdate=February 27, 2018}}</ref> until 2016.
====Philippine Olympic Committee==== {{see also|2016 and 2018 Philippine Olympic Committee elections}} [[File:POC elections feb 2018 winners b.jpg|thumb|Vargas' election as POC President in February 2018.]] Ricky Vargas first attempted to run for the position of Philippine Olympic Committee President in 2016, challenging then incumbent President, Jose "Peping" Cojuangco Jr. However his candidacy, along with Abraham Tolentino's who was vying for chairmanship, for the November 2016 elections were rejected after the sport's body commission on election which was led by [[Francisco Elizalde]] ruled them ineligible for being not being "active member". Vargas, who only attended in one general assembly of the POC, argued that being an active member does not equate to physical presence in the POC's general assembly. He attempted to have the November 2016 elections postponed by the Pasig Regional Trial Court to allow for dialogue between his camp and Cojuangco's but failed. Cojuangco secured a fourth term unopposed in the 2016 elections.
The Pasig court later ruled the results of the 2016 elections for the post of president and chairman null and void, said that the commission on elections cannot restrict or qualify the eligibility criteria of being an "active member", and ordered and election with Vargas and Tolentino as candidates to be held in February 23, 2018. An extraordinary meeting was held in February where the general assembly agreed to hold elections and a commissions on elections was formed which was also led by Francisco Elizalde. Given the latter fact, Vargas and Tolentino anticipated that they will be disqualified again though Elizalde allowed the two to run to avoid being cited in contempt by court despite the election head's view that the two are ineligible.
Vargas secured a 24–15 victory over Cojuangco for the post of POC President ending the latter's long tenure.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://sports.inquirer.net/285547/ricky-vargas-beats-peping-cojuangco-poc-presidency|title=Ricky Vargas beats Peping Cojuangco for POC presidency|publisher=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|last=Reyes|first=Marc Anthony|date=February 23, 2018|accessdate=February 23, 2018}}</ref> Vargas officially began his term<ref>{{cite news|last1=Pedralvez|first1=Bong|title=Oath-taking rites for POC leaders set|url=http://www.malaya.com.ph/business-news/sports/oath-taking-rites-poc-leaders-set|accessdate=8 March 2018|work=Malaya Business Insights|date=2 March 2018|quote=The source said Vargas preferred a separate occasion for the oath-taking “before he officially assumes his duties as the new POC president.”}}</ref> on March 5, 2018 when he took his oath before Philippine President [[Rodrigo Duterte]] in the [[Malacañang Palace]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lopez|first1=Virgil|title=New POC execs Vargas, Tolentino take oath before Duterte|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/645528/new-poc-execs-vargas-tolentino-take-oath-before-duterte/story/|accessdate=8 March 2018|work=GMA News|date=5 March 2018}}</ref> The first board meeting under Vargas' tenure was held the day after where his predecessor turned over the POC flag to Vargas.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ramos|first1=Gerry|title=Ricky Vargas reaches out to predecessor Peping Cojuangco as POC leadership officially turned over|url=https://www.spin.ph/psc-poc/news/ricky-vargas-reaches-out-to-predecessor-peping-cojuangco-as-poc-leadership-officially-turned-over|accessdate=8 March 2018|work=Sports Interactive Network Philippines|date=6 March 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== He is the grandson of [[Jorge B. Vargas]], who served as president of POC's predecessor, [[Philippine Amateur Athletic Federation]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.spin.ph/psc-poc/news/ricky-vargas-poc-election-philippine-olympic-committee-president|title=Ricky Vargas says 'flawed' decision disqualifying him from POC elections must be reversed|publisher=[[Sports Interactive Network Philippines]]|last=Ramos|first=Gerry|date=October 28, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2018}}</ref>

'''Rotary wheel blow molding systems''' are used for the high-output production of a wide variety of plastic extrusion [[blow molding|blow molded]] articles. Containers may be produced from small, single serve [[bottles]] to large containers up to 20-30 liters in volume - but wheel machines are often sized for the volume and dimensional demands of a specific container, and are typically dedicated to a narrow range of bottle sizes once built. Multiple [[parison]] machines, with high numbers of molds are capable of producing over one million bottles per day in some configurations.
== Description == Rotary blow molding "wheels" are targeted to the high output production of containers. They are used to produce containers from one to seven layers. View stripe and In Mold Labeling (IML) options are available in some configurations. Rotary wheels, which may contain from six to thirty molds, feature continuously extruded parisons. Revolving sets of blow molds capture the parison or parisons as they pass over the extrusion head. The revolving sets of molds are located on clamp "stations".
Rotary wheels come in different variations, including both continuous motion and indexing wheels, and vertical or horizontal variations. <ref> {{cite patent | number =US4213750A | title =Rotary blow molding machine | pubdate =1980 | inventor =Kubota, Yamamuchi | url =https://patents.google.com/patent/US4213750A/en }}</ref><ref> {{cite patent | number =US5698241A | title =Rotary plastic blow molding machine | pubdate =1997 | inventor =Kitzmiller | url =https://patents.google.com/patent/US5698241A/en }}</ref> Wheel machines are favored for their processing ease, due to having only single (or in some cases, two) parisons, and mechanical repeatability.
<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Rotary Wheel Blow Molder.png|450px|thumb|left|Rotary wheel blow molding machine operation]] -->
In some machinery configurations, the molds take on the shape of a "pie" sector. Thus, if two or more parisons are used, each blow molded "log" has a unique length, requiring special downstream handling and trimming requirements. In other machine configurations, the molds utilize "book style" opening mechanisms, allowing multiple parisons of equal length. However, machines of this style typically have lower clamp force, limiting the available applications.
The mold close and open actuation is typically carried out through a [[linkage (mechanical)|toggle mechanism]] linkage that is activated during the rotational process by stationary cams. This mechanical repeatability is considered an advantage by most processors.
The method of wheel rotation is typically conducted through an electric motor with a "pinion" gear or small gear to or in mesh with a rotating "bull" gear or large gear. All utilities for blowing containers and for mold cooling are carried through the main shaft or the axle from which the wheel rotates about. These utilities include compressed air and water. Sequencing functions necessary to inflate the parison, hold the container prior to discharge and discharge are completed by mechanical actuation to [[pneumatic]] valves – resulting in a high degree of repeatability.
==Advantages & disadvantages== <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Captured Parison.png|160px|thumb|right|Schematic showing captured parisons in a dual parison rotary wheel mold]] -->
Very tight weight and dimensional tolerances can be obtained on wheel equipment, as the parison is captured on both ends. It is pinched in the preceding mold on the leading end, and positioned by the stationary flowhead die on the other end. In [[shuttle machinery]] and [[reciprocating screw machinery]] multiple parisons are extruded and are free hanging. Because there is always some variation in the parison length on these machines, bottle weight and tolerance consistencies are not as tight as on rotary wheel machinery.
Other advantages of wheel equipment include: * Continuous extrusion * Multi-layer coextrusion, with one to seven layers of plastic in the finished part * In some applications, In Mold Labeling (IML) can be integrated with little or no cycle time penalty * Parison programming capability, for optimization of wall thickness * Reduced cycle time on light weight containers, compared to shuttle machinery. Conversely, wheel equipment may suffer cycle time penalties on thick containers * Easily implemented view stripe capability * Ability to achieve very high outputs from a single machine - lowest "cost per bottle" when compared to other blow molding equipment * Higher production efficiencies than most other extrusion blow molding equipment types
Disadvantages: * Inability to produce bottles with calibrated neck finishes * Downstream trimming required * Machines typically dedicated to a narrow range of sizes. Product change can be difficult, especially when downstream trimming changeovers are required. * High initial capital investment
== Applications ==
The growth of wheel machinery in the United States was spurred by the conversion of [[motor oil]] containers from [[paperboard]] cans to plastic [[bottle]]s, and the conversion of [[laundry detergent]] from powder to liquid form. Additional high volume applications have included single-serve [[juice]]s and drinkable [[yogurt]], [[condiment]]s, and household cleaning supplies.
==Books, general references== <references/> * Soroka, W, "Fundamentals of Packaging Technology", IoPP, 2002, {{ISBN|1-930268-25-4}} * Yam, K. L., "Encyclopedia of Packaging Technology", John Wiley & Sons, 2009, {{ISBN|978-0-470-08704-6}} {{packaging}}

{{Infobox person |name = Slavoljub Penkala |image = Slavoljub_Eduard_Penkala.jpg |image_size = 140px |caption = Slavoljub Penkala in 1920 |birth_name = Eduard Pękała |birth_date = {{Birth date|1871|4|20|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Liptovský Mikuláš|Liptószentmiklós]], [[Kingdom of Hungary]], [[Austria-Hungary]] |death_date = {{Death date and age|1922|2|5|1871|4|20|df=y}} |death_place = [[Zagreb]], [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes]] |death_cause = [[Pneumonia]] |resting_place = [[Mirogoj Cemetery]] |residence = |nationality = Croatian |ethnicity = |citizenship = |other_names = |known_for = Inventing the [[mechanical pencil]] |education = [[TU Dresden|Royal Saxon Polytechnic Institute]] <small>(Ph.D., 1898)</small> |employer = |occupation = {{hlist|Inventor|aviation pioneer|entrepreneur}} |years_active = |home_town = |religion = |spouse = Emily Stoffregen |partner = |children = 4 |parents = |relations = |callsign = |signature = |website = |footnotes = }}
'''Slavoljub Eduard Penkala''' ({{IPA-sh|slâʋɔʎuːb ɛ̂duard pɛŋkǎːla|hr}}) (20 April 1871 - 5 February 1922) was a [[Croatia]]n engineer and [[inventor]] of [[Dutch people|Dutch]]-[[Poles|Polish]]-[[Jews|Jewish]] descent.<ref>{{Cite news |last=|first=|title=Google obilježio 141. godišnjicu rođenja Slavoljuba Penkale|pages= |publisher=[[Nova TV (Croatia)|Nova TV]] |date=2012-04-20|url=http://dnevnik.hr/vijesti/tech/google-obiljezio-141-godisnjicu-rodzenja-slavoljuba-penkale.html|accessdate=2012-04-20|language=hr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |author=[[HINA]] |title=Google se sjetio Penkale |pages= |publisher=[[Business.hr]] |date=2012-04-20 |url=http://www.business.hr/business-class/google-se-sjetio-penkale |accessdate=2012-04-20 |language=hr |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120420134705/http://www.business.hr/business-class/google-se-sjetio-penkale |archivedate=2012-04-20 |df= }}</ref>
[[File:Penkala-Moster tvornica.jpg|thumb|right|200px|"Penkala-Moster" pen and pencil company in Zagreb]] Eduard Penkala was born in [[Liptovský Mikuláš|Liptószentmiklós]] (now Liptovský Mikuláš), then part of [[Austria-Hungary]], to Franciszek Pękała, who was of Polish heritage, and Maria Pękała (née Hannel), who was of Dutch descent. He attended the [[University of Vienna]] and [[TU Dresden|Royal Saxon Polytechnic Institute]], graduating from the latter on March 25, 1898, and going on to earn a [[doctorate]] in [[organic chemistry]]. During his studies, he attended violin lessons where he met his future wife, pianist Emily Stoffregen. He then moved with his wife to [[Zagreb]] (which was then in the [[Kingdom of Croatia-Slavonia]]). To mark his loyalty to his new homeland, he took on the Croatian name Slavoljub (the equivalent of slavophile), becoming a naturalized [[Croats|Croat]].
He became renowned for further development of the [[mechanical pencil]] (1906)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.penkala.com.hr/en/penkala_en.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-08-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006053423/http://www.penkala.com.hr/en/penkala_en.htm |archivedate=2008-10-06 |df= }}</ref> - then called an "automatic pencil" - and the first solid-ink [[fountain pen]] (1907).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.croatia.hr/English/Penkala/Inovacije.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-03-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070406220807/http://www.croatia.hr/English/Penkala/Inovacije.aspx |archivedate=2007-04-06 |df= }}</ref> Collaborating with an entrepreneur by the name of [[Edmund Moster]], he started the Penkala-Moster Company and built a pen-and-pencil factory that was one of the biggest in the world at the time. The company, now called [[TOZ Penkala]], still exists today.
He also constructed the first Croatian aircraft to fly in the country, the [[Penkala 1910 Biplane]], flown by [[Dragutin Novak]], who was also the first Croatian pilot. He constructed and invented many other products and devices, and held a total of 80 [[patent]]s.
Among his patented inventions were:
* a [[hot water bottle]] - his first patented invention, the "Termofor" * a type of bluing [[detergent]] * a rail-car [[brake]] * an [[battery (vacuum tube)#B battery|anode battery]]
He also founded another company called the Elevator Chemical Manufacturing Company, which produced various chemicals such as detergents, sealing wax, and "Radium Vinovica", a [[Patent medicine|patent-medicine]] – like product that was billed as curing [[rheumatism]].
He had four children with his wife, Emily.
Penkala died in Zagreb at the age of 50, after catching [[pneumonia]] on a business trip. He was buried at the [[Mirogoj Cemetery]].<ref>{{hr icon}} Gradska groblja Zagreb: Slavoljub Eduard Penkala, Mirogoj RKT-78-I-117</ref>
{{-}}

'''Srđan Radovanović''' (born 1959) is a [[Serbia]]n lawyer and business executive. He was employed at the Secretariat for Internal Affairs in [[Belgrade]] and he also worked as an [[Lawyer|attorney]]. He was part of the management teams at "Grand kafa" and "Droga Kolinska", a member of the board of directors of "Soko Štark" and the board president of "Palanački kiseljak".<ref>[http://www.novosti.rs/code/navigate.php?Id=5&status=jedna&vest=148566&title_add=Sr%C4%91an%20Radovanovi%C4%87%20na%20%C4%8Delu%20%22Jat%20ervejza%22&kword_add=jat%20ervejz,%20srdjan%20radovanovic Srđan Radovanović na čelu "Jat ervejza, ''Večernje novosti'', June 17, 2009]</ref>
On July 2, 2009, he became the [[chief executive officer]] (generalni direktor) of [[Jat Airways]],<ref>[http://www.blic.rs/drustvo.php?id=100028 Srđan Radovanović novi direktor "Jat ervejza", ''Blic'', July 2, 2009]</ref> the Serbian state-owned [[flag carrier]]. He had been appointed to the post by the [[Democratic Party (Serbia)|Democratic Party]] (DS). This appointment marked a break with the unwritten tradition that Jat CEOs should come from within the company and should have [[transport engineering]] backgrounds.<ref>[http://www.blic.rs/ekonomija.php?id=97739 Advokat na čelu „Jata”, ''Blic'', June 18, 2009]</ref>
In his first press interview after his appointment, Radovanović stated that Jat's loss during the calendar year 2008 was [[euro|€]]80 million.<ref>[http://www.blic.rs/ekonomija.php?id=101310 Očerupani avioni, ''Blic'', July 12, 2009] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090715064533/http://www.blic.rs/ekonomija.php?id=101310 |date=July 15, 2009 }}</ref>
During a brief interview in September, 2009, Radovanović said that in 2010, Jat Airways was expected to increase revenues to 150 million euros, and that there would be a further reduction in the company's losses. It was necessary to make large savings and this would be done by reducing the number of employees and introducing financial discipline in the company. Radovanovic also announced the renewal of a contract with the European aircraft manufacturer [[Airbus]] to renew the fleet and the acquisition of new aircraft.<ref>[http://www.b92.net/biz/vesti/tema.php?id=141&start=0&nav_id=382273 Jat očekuje 150 mil. € prihoda u 2010, "B92", September 19, 2009]</ref>
==Controversy== Barely weeks into the job at Jat, Radovanović got embroiled in controversy when Serbian print media claimed that he had enabled his brother Radovan Radovanović, news editor of ''[[24 sata (Serbia)|24 sata]]'' newspaper, to travel on a special flight from [[Hurghada]] to [[Luxor]] in [[Egypt]]. The flight was carrying the grieving family members of Serbian tourists who had been killed in a bus accident on July 16, 2009 and was sponsored by the government. The flight took off from Belgrade to Hurghada on July 20, 2009 so that the families could claim the bodies of their loved ones who had been involved in the accident. Radovan Radovanović had been sent by his newspaper to report from the accident site. The media claimed that, despite explicit orders from the [[Government of Serbia|Serbian Government]] that no one except family members should be on the flight, Radovanović had obtained a free ticket for his brother, thereby bypassing the added security.<ref>[http://www.pressonline.rs/page/stories/sr.html?view=story&id=73632&sectionId=37 Bruka i sramota: Direktor ‘Jata' ni mrtve ne poštuje!, ''Press'', July 23, 2009]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Radovanovic, Srdjan}} [[Category:Serbian businesspeople]] [[Category:1959 births]] [[Category:Living people]]
